data.event: Founded in 1729, Baltimore is the second largest seaport in the Mid-Atlantic.

event.title: shifted to a service-oriented economy, with the Johns Hopkins Hospital (founded 1889

data.event: After a decline in major manufacturing, industrialization and rail transportation, Baltimore shifted to a service-oriented economy, with the Johns Hopkins Hospital (founded 1889), and Johns Hopkins University (founded 1876), now the city's top two employers.
